com.netflix.governator

Class Governator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.netflix.governator.Governator
  • Deprecated. 
    2015-12-13 Use InjectorBuilder instead

    @Deprecated
public class Governator
extends java.lang.Object
    Main entry point for creating a LifecycleInjector with guice extensions such as support for @PostConstruct, @PreDestroy annotations and LifecycleListener. Example: new Governator() .addModules( new ArchaiusGovernatorModule(), new JettyModule(), new JerseyServletModule() { @@Override protected void configureServlets() { serve("/*").with(GuiceContainer.class); bind(GuiceContainer.class).asEagerSingleton(); bind(HelloWorldApp.class).asEagerSingleton(); } } ) .run() .awaitTermination();

      • addModuleListTransformer

        public Governator addModuleListTransformer(ModuleListTransformer transformer)
        Deprecated. 
        Add a ModuleListTransformer that will be invoked on the final list of modules prior to creating the injectors. Multiple transformers may be added with each transforming the result of the previous one.
        Parameters:
        transformer - A transformer
        Returns:
        this

      • addOverrideModules

        public Governator addOverrideModules(Module... modules)
        Deprecated. 
        Add override modules for any modules add via addModules or that are conditionally loaded. This is useful for testing or when an application absolutely needs to override a binding to fix a binding problem in the code modules
        Parameters:
        modules - Modules that will be applied as overrides to modules
        Returns:
        this

      • addOverrideModules

        public Governator addOverrideModules(java.util.List<Module> modules)
        Deprecated. 
        Add override modules for any modules add via addModules or that are conditionally loaded. This is useful for testing or when an application absolutely needs to override a binding to fix a binding problem in the code modules
        Parameters:
        modules - Modules that will be applied as overrides to modules
        Returns:
        this
